rComments: Dean is AMAZING. He makes sense of the most complex readings and completely changes how you view politics and the world. He chooses  brilliant works and fosters an open atmosphere where students can make any connections they wish. His main goal in this class is to get students politically active through learning political theory, and it works.
Most engaging lecturer I've ever ha .

Very enthusiastic about topic and funny sometimes which made lectures tolerable considering I had zero interest in the class. Essays were toughly graded. Sections were not helpful at all but they are mandatory

Dean is the best professor at UCSC. I was in 190B because my other seminar was cancelled, and have no regrets. It was also the most difficult class that I've ever taken. He's a tough grader: 8-10 pg papers (with no prompts), but is there for you 100% & he improved my writing a lot. You'll work hard & you'll grow as a person, not just academically.

Probably the most demanding class I've taken in POLI or anywhere at UCSC for that matter. Intellectually challenging / provocative interpretations of classic texts---this is not stuff you pick up casually. Paper prompts are complex and he directs his TAs to be strict graders. Fortunately worth it -- my brain explodes with insight after every class

Lectures are long, unclear, and don't have an organized feel. The readings were really confusing, but his lectures did not clarify, in fact sometimes just made everything more confusing. I stopped going to class about halfway through the quarter, but I did the readings and did well on the papersfinal. The class is totally doable, just not great

Professor Mathiowetz is very motivated and enthusiastic when teaching the subject. If a student has a concern he will address it at the best of his ability. He is a great professor, just do the readings and go to lecture.

His enthusiasm is contagious. A personable, energetic lecturer willing to discuss the material until you really understand it. He's completely transparent about some readings being hard to chew through but makes them all excitingclear in lecture. If you do the reading, show up to lecture & really pay attention you shouldn't have trouble passing. !

Taking a class with Mathiowetz can be intense. Lectures are energizing with creative interpretations of texts. Paper prompts are tough but clearly defined; reading load is over the top. He's friendly and helpful in office hours. If you are attracted to the male physique, this adds another layer of intensity because, uhm, yeah. :-)

If you like being challenged and engaged in a class, this is the professor for you. He's extremely tough; when I had my work graded he provided pages of notes as to why he graded the way he did and extensive tips for improving my writing for the next assignment. He was also quick to respond to emails, but office hours were always packed.

Mathiowetz's themes are interesting and creative but not basic, this is not an introductory course. He is an incredibly tough and almost mean grader on essays sort of at odds with his friendly demeanor. But his comments were super useful and so I did better on my final which boosted my grade. A "sink or swim" class for sure
SO SMART OH MY GOD. On top of being personable and gorgeous he is seriously one of the most amazing professors at UCSC. I adore him.

While the text are old, Dean's approach is not. This class is challenging, but he breaks down difficult passages clearly. His lectures are outlined & on the board as soon as you walk in, so you know exactly what will be covered. Yes, he's attractive, but he is also so knowledgable. Make sure to visit office hours. Really cares about his students :)

This class just concluded today, and I have to say it was honestly the best class I've ever taken. Surprising, seeing as I've tried to tackle some of the texts before and lost interest. Prof. Mathiowetz reframed everything in a way that changed my perspective. He is a great lecturer, and I left class every day with a renewed sense of inspiration.

this man is hottttt !! ummm yah his lec on the greek body is not to be missed. energetic professor and humorous. friendly but impossible to get into his office hours they're all booked. reading load is insane but TA sections help.

first off, fantastic beard. The girls sit in the front row just to get a better look. It's obvious he really loves teaching his subject and puts an, maybe excessive, effort into his lectures.he can't be much older than 30 so using Simpsons and iphone metaphors really helps students relate and get a clearer understanding. fun class, not an easy A

super passionate and engaging lectures. seems like a good guy who cares about students. reading load is heavy, this is not an easy class. also can be hard to focus on lecture sometimes because YES he is excruciatingly hot. his office hours are packed haha.

This class is far from easy, BUT hes very funny,and keeps lecture entertaining. He does talk really fast to cover lots of material but he is clearly very passionate about what he teaches and a fine scholar. When I say fine scholar I mean FINE scholar. He is SO unbelievably hot its hard to concentrate. Perfect 'Anthropos' if ya learned anything ;)
Dean's brilliance is infectious and his instruction is very personable and attentive. Far from easy, but a great learning and thinking experience. Highly recommended.

Great teacher.His lectures are witty and entertaining.He's smart, funny and such a good speaker.Makes the (boring) subject interesting. Be aware he can speak a mile a min and go off on tangents about his own interpretation on material.Prompts for paper are very creative.He is super approachable in person.UNBELIEVABLY HOT and too PERFECT to be true.
Mathiowetz is a good teacher and he makes a boring subject (Political Theory of Luxury) bearable... He is a tough grader though...
The TAs were not useless. I deserved the grade I got. You are probably just bitter.

Great professor who made an otherwise tortuous subject (ancient political thought) interesting. His class was hard, with grades based 1/3 on section participation and 2/3 on two 8-10 page papers. You have plenty of time to work on the papers though (2 weeks) so its not too bad. He expects a high level of work, but you won't end up hating him.

Seemed passionate about the subject but was still boring. Would launch into his lectures like he was racing the clock, and I still had trouble staying awake. His rapid lectures made note taking difficult and I often felt like he was trying to cover too much material. I was interested in the subject but he killed it for me. Will skip his classes.

They shouldn't let men this attractive teach politics, it throws poli students off. Fine specimine of 'anthropos'. This class was tough, and very boring near the beginning. The sexual tension in the room will keep you awake, but his lectures on Ancient Philosophy and the Peloponesian War, despite his best efforts, are really sleep inducing.

Very self centered.  Wanted you to feel sorry for him because of his student loans and not having tenure and how difficult that is (according to him).  if you like the subject and get on his good side, its for you, but if you are a normal person this guy really isn't for you.  dismissive, thinks average students ideas are not as good.

Mathiowetz is very enthusiastic about his subject but I fell asleep after an hour of his lecture each time. Perhaps this is my fault but I'm not usually a sleeper. The lectures got repetative and dull after a while. The work load was light though which was nice. Overall I wasted my time with this class
Mathiowetz is a very promising young scholar.  Very clear and a pleasure to listen to.  I highly recommend taking a class or two from him.  You won't be disappointed.

I learned very little from his lectures. I expected something interesting and focused around the issues described in the course description, such as Citizenship, and Gay marriage. The readings were rediculose to understand. He called on students to guide lecture. I did not know who to believe, the students or him.

Awesome class !! Mathiowetz is organized and cares about the students. Really made me think in some new ways. Very well-dressed which I think says he cares about teaching and takes students seriously. Always very respectful. And, yes, super hot.

Very well dressed, and good looking, but somewhat difficult to understand the concepts. Readings are very dense, and TA is very difficult and critical of our answers. Extremely tough on grading our papers, and hard to keep up with the lectures due to too much info covered in so little time.

Awesome teacher. Funny, attractive, organized, brilliant. Very dense reading, but his leactures clear a lot up. Essays are pretty hard, and TA's are instructed to grade pretty rough as well. Reasonable expectations. I definitle reccomend him.

Lectures are super organized and clear tries to give cues to let you know he is transitioning extra points for impeccable dress and Hotness!!  though I was not interested in subject at first Dean makes ancient political theory interesting and very rich. So much info in a few short weeks but well worth it. should have taken this class in beginning.
Horrible teacher. Ridiculous expectations, favors some students over others. Totally unapproachable. Boring as all hell. Requiring attendance for upper division courses is pretentious.

I took this class as a freshman during my first quarter, and now in retrospect I can see that this professor is one of a kind! He was very easy to understand and tried his best to make his lectures interesting. He also genuinely cares about his students and doesn't see them as a lump of useless undergraduates, as some other professors do.

Mathiowetz is a good guy, gives organized lectures, relevant assignments.  Lectures are almost entirely driven by student discussion so if you get some overly opinionated people it gets old quick.  There were like 300 kids in Poli 4 but he knew the names of everyone that spoke.  TA was a joke, Marco Mojica--complete dumbass

Interesting professor, like others said, he lets his students talk a lot.  So be prepared for a section discussion with tangents in a lecture setting, a little awkward for that reason.  Keep up with the reading and actually use office hours and optional section times to familiarize yourself with the texts.
Mathiowetz is very fun and enthusiastic, however he packs a lot of dense information into a short period of time.

Overall, I enjoyed the class.  During Mathiowetz's lectures, he let the students talk too much, and therefore it was hard to receive the main points.  The class is very theoretical, so be prepared and keep that in mind before you decide to take the class.
let students talk to much and go off on tangets. an obscure subject to begin with, but did a great job and clarifying the readings during lecture
he's a passionate professor and very humorous, but focuses too much on hearing the students' opinions and not enough on lecturing. the readings were hard to understand.

Material and reading was difficult, but he did a great job of analyzing the reading.  Lectures were very organized and easy to understand and he made himself very approachable for harder concepts both after class and in office hours.  It is a very challenging course, but he did a great job of making political texts accessible to students!
Very good lecturer, clear and concise.  Class is hard.  Makes material interesting.
lectures were interesting, he's very passionate about the material. class consists of one short paper, 4page midterm paper, and two public meeting assignments, final is 2 random essay questions.

The class would have been more interesting if the readings weren't so hard and he explained them a little more clearly. As a person he is a very nice guy and hes really hot. he like you to give your imput and he trys really hard to learn his students names.  if you take this class just be prepared for confusing and frusturated reading!!

This class was unbelievably boring. Especially towards the end of the quarter, I could barely even sit throught the lectures without falling asleep. He's a nice guy and tries really hard, but most the time he is unclear and dull.

mathiowetz gives informative clear and stimulating lectures. and makes the material relevant. he also is a nice guy and maybe the most intelligent person i have ever met. only problem (?) is its easy to get distracted by how ultra fine he is....
take any class by mathiowetz, it's worthwhile

He's a pretty good professor.he's very engaging and welcomes input from the students, which is great. The only thing is that his lectures can be unclear sometimes----That being said, he's HOT! And i'm talking the jaw dropping-drool-from-mouth-stare-at-him-constantly-hot-for-teacher kind of hot. I want him. Badly. Thank god for anonymity!
He doesn't have excesxxive amounts of work and he is very approachable outside of class. He seems genuinly interested in getting to know his students and helping them work through the material.
He's very nice and inviting to talk to, but the class consists of students talking and him commenting on what they say. Not very helpful for understanding the material.
Very nice teacher, with a good manner.  He was very helpful when I went to visit him in office hours and gives a good lecture!
he's hot, he's on top of his****, and he's hot.

This class was AMAZING! dean puts so much passion into his work that it's hard not to get really into the class. warning, it's A LOT of work, but so worth it. plus, he's hot with about ten thousand t's.
No Comments
great teacher!!  very clear and very smart....with one hell of a cute ass to stare at ladies!!!!!!!!!!!!
This guy is cool.
Great teacher, extreemly smart, well organized. His reading choices were frustrating to me, but he did a great job overall. Kinda hard, but great teacher if you will apply yourself.
challenging class, but this is by far the best politics teacher in the department
Great professor. Has a lot of enthusiasm in lectures and makes dry material very relevant and interesting. Two 8-10 page papers and an ungraded final.
Hot and passionate about what he teaches, though I did get lost a lot of times wondering what he was jabbering about. Really hot though! Oh, and did I say great body?
Excellent lecturer, very friendly, very knowledgeable and full of energy...  One problem for slackers: if you do not do the reading, you will be horribly lost in lecture.
I got tricked into taking this class, a better title would be "Ancient political theory" wierd winter quater he is teaching the same class!! I HATE THIS CLASS.

he is so energetic that it is engaging, but i wish he would not take so many comments from the students during lecture time because most of what they say is useless and distracts mathiowetz from his interesting points. it makes it hard to learn and stay focused.

He is a great teacher, i had a great TA too. He is ****en Hot.... i wish he was gay. You will learn alot he got me interested in Ancient Political thought.....He is the Reason why i am a Politics Major
Mathiowetz is generally engaging, but never ceases to dance around a point he is trying to make. For the most part, the reading/assignments can be done without lecture.
He's hot!  He's nice!  He's really easy to understand and has a wonderful sense of humor!  If it weren't for the quality of his class I might have given up on college.  He's excellent.

really good class! he makes a huge lecture seem like a small discussion class. also, good motivation to go to class is so you can see him, because he is damn sexy! i had a hard time concentrating and stop fantasising.

He genuinely cares about what students think and spends a large part of lecture listening to comments and questions, trying to make readings clearer/easier for us. Has extensive notes on what to talk about it sometimes outline that is well organized. Reading can be tough but must do them. Hes sexy 2

he's really really really goodlooking. cool guy too. he takes a while to get to the point in his lectures, and if you don't do the reading (like me) you'll be horribly lost. However, he's always available to answer questions. oh, and did i mention that he's incredibly sexy??

I wish I could have taken one of Dean's lecture courses because everything he said in my seminar course was interesting smart and well-articulated. He's very helpful and kept a lame senior seminar class fun.  He's intelligent and extremely good looking.
just an amazing prof, obviously puts together curriculum/lectures very thoughtfully. very engaging
Excellent lecturer, very friendly, very knowledgeable and full of energy... One problem for slackers: if you do not do the reading, you will be horribly lost in lecture.
energetic lecture, and probably the hottest male proff on campus

I loved this class! Really interesting readings and the lecture discussions helped me understand them. And Dean also cares what students think about the reading. He's even patient with dumb questions. That can be good or bad! ;)

Smart, young and full of energy!  I realy enjoyed Dean's class and plan to focus on theory next year.  Looks like the Politics Dept. if bringing new, strong blood back into the program.  Also, Dean is a totally sexy - to the point of distraction.
best, most thorough, most useful written comments on my work i have ever gotten. he actually read and thought about my draft. also a nice guy.
super nice guy, always made himself available in office hours to help on my paper and suggest ideas. cares a lot about students getting the material and having something to say

totally engaged and energetic professor, who wants students to understand and will back up to explain any question, people who get lost in lecture are probably paying attention to the wrong thing (see below)?

Mathiowetz: interesting prof, always full of spunk to the point he would be bubbling with flamboyance and this is odd considering the material (theory regarding every particular political application of "interest") He has huge methodological pro

Excellent professor, excellent class lectures.  I felt really engaged and motivated to come to class (like I used to with Euben's classes).  My only complaint was that I would get distracted wondering what Dean looked like w/o clothes on.  :)
since this is a lower division class it is really easy, and he manages to get a large class involved in lectures which is rare.  it is also rare to find a professor so damn sexy!
No Comments

He's a great professor that's very thorough w/ his notes.  If he's doing a section, TAKE IT.  He's very approachable and his work is challenging.  He crams a whole lot of material in and it can be overwhelming but just go to class every day and you'll be fine.  And yes, he's very HAWT.

Mathiowetz seems to be a nice guy, and he is an interesting lecturer. That being said, I didn't really enjoy the class. Mathiowetz seemed to making his argument about the texts, which is okay, it is something Vanita Seth carries off quite well, but with Mathiowetz I felt something was lost.

This class was amazing-covers important, interesting information pertaining to society & life. Lectures were really easy to understand & almost always thought provoking. Mathiowetz communicates really well w/students & he's funny which can makes class interesting. He makes learning less stressful.

this professor is very funny, extremely engaging, and very helpful to students both inside and outside of class. He really cares about his students, and works very hard to make difficult material accessible. Coaxes the best out of every student. Really loves teaching and his students.
I LOVED this professor

Ancient Pol Theory is a very demanding class! Huge reading load. If you don't do it you will have no idea what is going on! Strict deadlines. But really worth it. Lectures were awesome, sometimes gripping, sometimes inspirational. Plus he's super hot. And nice! Good class.

Best class I have ever taken. Class is challenging, and there is a lot of reading but Dean is kind, funny and very intelligent. Comical obsession with T.V. and Halo 2. Eager to help students and very approachable.  Able to turn large lectures into group discussion.  Very highly reccomended

Hot!  Nice!  Helpful!  Fun!  I highly recommend this class for people trying to get GE's out of the way and majors of political science alike.  The reading could drag, but when he explained it I wanted to read them again because of how interesting he made them...  hot! hot! hot!  Take his class!!!!

Not a good teacher.  People who liked him didn't have the right perspective.  His lectures weren't the most boring I've ever had, but he didn't come close to tapping the potential of an intro. to Political Theory class.  Readings were TERRIBLE.  BOO.
Great lecturer, gets students talking and allows for a dialogue while somehow staying on track with his lecture notes.  Good selection of readings, a fair (not easy) grading scale.  Funny guy.

Had him for Poli 4 also;very concientious; never inserts personal opinion; Even if you have a tendency to space out, he will never be unclear. Easy to take notes; the reading is heavy but he explains it very well;very friendly and helpful during office hours; VERY handsome.

I hate this class. Dean takes way too many comments from the idiots in the class, and he expects you to read what is seriously the most boring junk ever written. The final and essays were a joke, very easy if you study for a couple hours, I got As on the essays doing them the night before. Bad class
awesome professor, really made me love the class though I wasnt that interested when i first signed up for it, lots of energy
I've only seen three lectures and one section and have already learned more than some classes an entire quarter. Also a very attractive man. Teaches a section which is rare -- he must like teaching.
always made the class interesting. never a dull moment. chicks dig him.
GREAT TEACHER
Great professor, really enjoyed the class.

this was the best intro class i have had at ucsc. even if some students comments weren't great he had to let people talk since the theme of the class was participation! and he made you think. he's also super nice. good prof.

He is a great professor, his lectures are clear and undertandable. There was a fair amount of work, about 2 papers and a section presentation plus a final test. Overall, he was one of the best professors I've had.
